page.title: 10LEEDS-LIVERPOOL CANAL
page.content: The canal,which is 127 miles long, was {built by Sir Benjanin Gott's} engineers to carry cargo. Today,it is mainly used for{leisure cruising.}The 4th year children went on the canal as part of the Humanities course. The hired narrow boat was 70 feet by 4 feet and had been equipped for leisure cruising. The maximum speed allowed was 4 mph to prevent the banks from being damaged by wash. We encountered several{locks}which we opened manually.One series took almost an hour to climb. Travelling the canal we passed Armley Mills, Kirkstall Abbey and old factories.We saw a half- sunken ice breaker, no longer needed. In one day we travelled from {Leeds {Basin to Rodley.}We were able to experience what conditions were like in past times. { Vanessa & Amanda, AGE 13 yrs.
